Posts.Content: serapdrsn wrote: Hello everyone, I am currently taking Doxorubicin and Cytoxan as a dose-dense treatment every 2 weeks for my invasive ductal carcinoma. I have read some articles on the internet saying that dose-dense treatment produces better overall survival and lower recurrence rates than standard treatment which is every 3 weeks. I had my 2nd cycle today and i will take the 3rd two weeks later but i am currently overthinking about this dose-dense articles on internet, because after my 1st cycle , my doctor delayed the 2nd cycle for one week, because of a national holiday. My other treatments will be on time, but i really felt down because i read there are dramatical changes between 2 week and 3 week cycles. What do you think, will it affect my prognosis, or pCR probability maybe? Sorry for my bad English, i hope every one of you gets well and cured soon. . Dx 7/10/2017, IDC, Right, 4cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery Mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dose-Dense AC Chemo 1 Week Delay serapdrsn anotherNYCGirl
